intro: Cnestis pseudoracemosa, commonly known as the false raceme cnestis, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters. Its leaves are opposite, simple, and often have a velvety texture. It is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks.
